title: Can I use my name as a DBA for my LLC?
question: I have an LLC but would also like to use my name for the DBA of my LLC. Is this possible? If so, does that mean that any business check written to me using my name become company revenue?
answers:
One of the reasons for forming an LLC is to protect you from personal liability for the debts of the business. Using your name as dba of LLC defeats that purpose as you are essentially commingling your name and assets with the LLC. It is a bad idea, legally.

If you believe your name has value in the business, change the name of the LLC to John Doe LLC.

I agree with my colleague that it's a bad idea and risks letting a claimant "pierce" the "corporate veil" that the LLC is designed to protect. You need to keep your individual business scrupulously separate from your business affairs so you don't invite lawsuits against you personally.
